  16. (** System interface.

  18.   Every function in this module raises [Sys_error] with an
  19.   informative message when the underlying system call signal
  20.   an error.
  21. *)

  23. external argv : string array = "%sys_argv"
  24. (** The command line arguments given to the process.
  25.    The first element is the command name used to invoke the program.
  26.    The following elements are the command-line arguments
  27.    given to the program. *)

  29. ‌val executable_name : string
  30. (** The name of the file containing the executable currently running.
  31.     This name may be absolute or relative to the current directory, depending
  32.     on the platform and whether the program was compiled to bytecode or a native
  33.     executable. *)

  35. external file_exists : string -> bool = "caml_sys_file_exists"
  36. (** Test if a file with the given name exists. *)

  38. external is_directory : string -> bool = "caml_sys_is_directory"
  39. (** Returns [true] if the given name refers to a directory,
  40.     [false] if it refers to another kind of file.
  41.     @raise Sys_error if no file exists with the given name.
  42.     @since 3.10
  43. *)

  45. external is_regular_file : string -> bool = "caml_sys_is_regular_file"
  46. (** Returns [true] if the given name refers to a regular file,
  47.     [false] if it refers to another kind of file.
  48.     @raise Sys_error if no file exists with the given name.
  49.     @since 5.1
  50. *)

  52. external remove : string -> unit = "caml_sys_remove"
  53. (** Remove the given file name from the file system. *)

  55. external rename : string -> string -> unit = "caml_sys_rename"
  56. (** Rename a file or directory.  [rename oldpath newpath] renames the
  57.     file or directory called [oldpath], giving it [newpath] as its new name,
  58.     moving it between (parent) directories if needed.  If a file named
  59.     [newpath] already exists, its contents will be replaced with those of
  60.     [oldpath].
  61.     Depending on the operating system, the metadata (permissions,
  62.     owner, etc) of [newpath] can either be preserved or be replaced by
  63.     those of [oldpath].
  64.    @since 4.06 concerning the "replace existing file" behavior *)

  66. external getenv : string -> string = "caml_sys_getenv"
  67. (** Return the value associated to a variable in the process
  68.    environment.
  69.    @raise Not_found if the variable is unbound. *)

  71. val getenv_opt: string -> string option
  72. (** Return the value associated to a variable in the process
  73.     environment or [None] if the variable is unbound.
  74.     @since 4.05
  75. *)

  77. external command : string -> int = "caml_sys_system_command"
  78. (** Execute the given shell command and return its exit code.

  80.   The argument of {!Sys.command} is generally the name of a
  81.   command followed by zero, one or several arguments, separated
  82.   by whitespace.  The given argument is interpreted by a
  83.   shell: either the Windows shell [cmd.exe] for the Win32 ports of
  84.   OCaml, or the POSIX shell [sh] for other ports.  It can contain
  85.   shell builtin commands such as [echo], and also special characters
  86.   such as file redirections [>] and [<], which will be honored by the
  87.   shell.

  89.   Conversely, whitespace or special shell characters occurring in
  90.   command names or in their arguments must be quoted or escaped
  91.   so that the shell does not interpret them.  The quoting rules vary
  92.   between the POSIX shell and the Windows shell.
  93.   The {!Filename.quote_command} performs the appropriate quoting
  94.   given a command name, a list of arguments, and optional file redirections.
  95. *)

  97. external time : unit -> (float [@unboxed]) =
  98.   "caml_sys_time" "caml_sys_time_unboxed" [@@noalloc]
  99. (** Return the processor time, in seconds, used by the program
  100.    since the beginning of execution. *)

  102. external chdir : string -> unit = "caml_sys_chdir"
  103. (** Change the current working directory of the process. *)

  105. external mkdir : string -> int -> unit = "caml_sys_mkdir"
  106. (** Create a directory with the given permissions.

  108.     @since 4.12
  109. *)

  111. external rmdir : string -> unit = "caml_sys_rmdir"
  112. (** Remove an empty directory.

  114.     @since 4.12
  115. *)

  117. external getcwd : unit -> string = "caml_sys_getcwd"
  118. (** Return the current working directory of the process. *)

  120. external readdir : string -> string array = "caml_sys_read_directory"
  121. (** Return the names of all files present in the given directory.
  122.    Names denoting the current directory and the parent directory
  123.    (["."] and [".."] in Unix) are not returned.  Each string in the
  124.    result is a file name rather than a complete path.  There is no
  125.    guarantee that the name strings in the resulting array will appear
  126.    in any specific order; they are not, in particular, guaranteed to
  127.    appear in alphabetical order. *)

  129. val interactive : bool ref
  130. [@@alert unsynchronized_access
  131.     "The interactive status is a mutable global state."
  132. ]
  133. (** This reference is initially set to [false] in standalone
  134.    programs and to [true] if the code is being executed under
  135.    the interactive toplevel system [ocaml]. *)

  137. val os_type : string
  138. (** Operating system currently executing the OCaml program. One of
  139. -  ["Unix"] (for all Unix versions, including Linux and Mac OS X),
  140. -  ["Win32"] (for MS-Windows, OCaml compiled with MSVC++ or MinGW-w64),
  141. -  ["Cygwin"] (for MS-Windows, OCaml compiled with Cygwin). *)

  143. ‌type backend_type =
  144.   | Native
  145.   | Bytecode
  146.   | Other of string (**)
  147. (** Currently, the official distribution only supports [Native] and
  148.     [Bytecode], but it can be other backends with alternative
  149.     compilers, for example, javascript.

  151.     @since 4.04
  152. *)

  154. ‌val backend_type : backend_type
  155. (** Backend type  currently executing the OCaml program.
  156.     @since 4.04
  157. *)

  159. ‌val unix : bool
  160. (** True if [Sys.os_type = "Unix"].
  161.     @since 4.01 *)

  163. ‌val win32 : bool
  164. (** True if [Sys.os_type = "Win32"].
  165.     @since 4.01 *)

  167. ‌val cygwin : bool
  168. (** True if [Sys.os_type = "Cygwin"].
  169.     @since 4.01 *)

  171. ‌val word_size : int
  172. (** Size of one word on the machine currently executing the OCaml
  173.     program, in bits: 32 or 64. *)

  175. ‌val int_size : int
  176. (** Size of [int], in bits. It is 31 (resp. 63) when using OCaml on a
  177.     32-bit (resp. 64-bit) platform. It may differ for other implementations,
  178.     e.g. it can be 32 bits when compiling to JavaScript.
  179.     @since 4.03 *)

  181. ‌val big_endian : bool
  182. (** Whether the machine currently executing the Caml program is big-endian.
  183.     @since 4.00 *)

  185. ‌val max_string_length : int
  186. (** Maximum length of strings and byte sequences. *)

  188. ‌val max_array_length : int
  189. (** Maximum length of a normal array (i.e. any array whose elements are
  190.     not of type [float]). The maximum length of a [float array]
  191.     is [max_floatarray_length] if OCaml was configured with
  192.     [--enable-flat-float-array] and [max_array_length] if configured
  193.     with [--disable-flat-float-array]. *)

  195. ‌val max_floatarray_length : int
  196. (** Maximum length of a floatarray. This is also the maximum length of
  197.     a [float array] when OCaml is configured with
  198.     [--enable-flat-float-array]. *)

  200. external runtime_variant : unit -> string = "caml_runtime_variant"
  201. (** Return the name of the runtime variant the program is running on.
  202.     This is normally the argument given to [-runtime-variant] at compile
  203.     time, but for byte-code it can be changed after compilation.
  204.     @since 4.03 *)

  206. external runtime_parameters : unit -> string = "caml_runtime_parameters"
  207. (** Return the value of the runtime parameters, in the same format
  208.     as the contents of the [OCAMLRUNPARAM] environment variable.
  209.     @since 4.03 *)


  212. (** {1 Signal handling} *)


  215. ‌type signal_behavior =
  216.     Signal_default
  217.   | Signal_ignore
  218.   | Signal_handle of (int -> unit)   (** *)
  219. (** What to do when receiving a signal:
  220.    - [Signal_default]: take the default behavior
  221.      (usually: abort the program)
  222.    - [Signal_ignore]: ignore the signal
  223.    - [Signal_handle f]: call function [f], giving it the signal
  224.    number as argument. *)

  226. external signal :
  227.   int -> signal_behavior -> signal_behavior = "caml_install_signal_handler"
  228. (** Set the behavior of the system on receipt of a given signal.  The
  229.    first argument is the signal number.  Return the behavior
  230.    previously associated with the signal. If the signal number is
  231.    invalid (or not available on your system), an [Invalid_argument]
  232.    exception is raised. *)

  234. ‌val set_signal : int -> signal_behavior -> unit
  235. (** Same as {!Sys.signal} but return value is ignored. *)


  238. (** {2 Signal numbers for the standard POSIX signals.} *)

  240. ‌val sigabrt : int
  241. (** Abnormal termination *)

  243. ‌val sigalrm : int
  244. (** Timeout *)

  246. ‌val sigfpe : int
  247. (** Arithmetic exception *)

  249. ‌val sighup : int
  250. (** Hangup on controlling terminal *)

  252. ‌val sigill : int
  253. (** Invalid hardware instruction *)

  255. ‌val sigint : int
  256. (** Interactive interrupt (ctrl-C) *)

  258. ‌val sigkill : int
  259. (** Termination (cannot be ignored) *)

  261. ‌val sigpipe : int
  262. (** Broken pipe *)

  264. ‌val sigquit : int
  265. (** Interactive termination *)

  267. ‌val sigsegv : int
  268. (** Invalid memory reference *)

  270. ‌val sigterm : int
  271. (** Termination *)

  273. ‌val sigusr1 : int
  274. (** Application-defined signal 1 *)

  276. ‌val sigusr2 : int
  277. (** Application-defined signal 2 *)

  279. ‌val sigchld : int
  280. (** Child process terminated *)

  282. ‌val sigcont : int
  283. (** Continue *)

  285. ‌val sigstop : int
  286. (** Stop *)

  288. ‌val sigtstp : int
  289. (** Interactive stop *)

  291. ‌val sigttin : int
  292. (** Terminal read from background process *)

  294. ‌val sigttou : int
  295. (** Terminal write from background process *)

  297. ‌val sigvtalrm : int
  298. (** Timeout in virtual time *)

  300. ‌val sigprof : int
  301. (** Profiling interrupt *)

  303. ‌val sigbus : int
  304. (** Bus error
  305.     @since 4.03 *)

  307. ‌val sigpoll : int
  308. (** Pollable event
  309.     @since 4.03 *)

  311. ‌val sigsys : int
  312. (** Bad argument to routine
  313.     @since 4.03 *)

  315. ‌val sigtrap : int
  316. (** Trace/breakpoint trap
  317.     @since 4.03 *)

  319. ‌val sigurg : int
  320. (** Urgent condition on socket
  321.     @since 4.03 *)

  323. ‌val sigxcpu : int
  324. (** Timeout in cpu time
  325.     @since 4.03 *)

  327. ‌val sigxfsz : int
  328. (** File size limit exceeded
  329.     @since 4.03 *)


  332. exception Break
  333. (** Exception raised on interactive interrupt if {!Sys.catch_break}
  334.    is on. *)


  337. ‌val catch_break : bool -> unit
  338. (** [catch_break] governs whether interactive interrupt (ctrl-C)
  339.    terminates the program or raises the [Break] exception.
  340.    Call [catch_break true] to enable raising [Break],
  341.    and [catch_break false] to let the system
  342.    terminate the program on user interrupt. *)


  345. ‌val ocaml_version : string
  346. (** [ocaml_version] is the version of OCaml.
  347.     It is a string of the form
  348.       ["major.minor[.patchlevel][(+|~)additional-info]"],
  349.     where [major], [minor], and [patchlevel] are integers, and
  350.     [additional-info] is an arbitrary string.
  351.     The [[.patchlevel]] part was absent before version 3.08.0 and
  352.     became mandatory from 3.08.0 onwards.
  353.     The [[(+|~)additional-info]] part may be absent. *)

  355. ‌val development_version : bool
  356. (** [true] if this is a development version, [false] otherwise.
  357.     @since 4.14
  358. *)

  360. ‌type extra_prefix = Plus | Tilde
  361. (** @since 4.14 *)

  363. ‌type extra_info = extra_prefix * string
  364. (** @since 4.14 *)

  366. ‌type ocaml_release_info = {
  367.   major : int;
  368.   minor : int;
  369.   patchlevel : int;
  370.   extra : extra_info option
  371. }
  372. (** @since 4.14 *)

  374. ‌val ocaml_release : ocaml_release_info
  375. (** [ocaml_release] is the version of OCaml.
  376.     @since 4.14
  377. *)

  379. ‌val enable_runtime_warnings: bool -> unit
  380. [@@alert unsynchronized_access
  381.     "The status of runtime warnings is a mutable global state."
  382. ]
  383. (** Control whether the OCaml runtime system can emit warnings
  384.     on stderr.  Currently, the only supported warning is triggered
  385.     when a channel created by [open_*] functions is finalized without
  386.     being closed.  Runtime warnings are disabled by default.

  388.     @since 4.03 *)

  390. ‌val runtime_warnings_enabled: unit -> bool
  391. [@@alert unsynchronized_access
  392.     "The status of runtime warnings is a mutable global state."
  393. ]
  394. (** Return whether runtime warnings are currently enabled.

  396.     @since 4.03 *)

  398. (** {1 Optimization} *)

  400. external opaque_identity : 'a -> 'a = "%opaque"
  401. (** For the purposes of optimization, [opaque_identity] behaves like an
  402.     unknown (and thus possibly side-effecting) function.

  404.     At runtime, [opaque_identity] disappears altogether.

  406.     A typical use of this function is to prevent pure computations from being
  407.     optimized away in benchmarking loops.  For example:
  408.     {[
  409.       for _round = 1 to 100_000 do
  410.         ignore (Sys.opaque_identity (my_pure_computation ()))
  411.       done
  412.     ]}

  414.     @since 4.03
  415. *)

  417. module Immediate64 : sig
  418.   (** This module allows to define a type [t] with the [immediate64]
  419.       attribute. This attribute means that the type is immediate on 64
  420.       bit architectures. On other architectures, it might or might not
  421.       be immediate.

  423.       @since 4.10
  424.   *)

  426.   module type Non_immediate = sig
  427. ‌    type t
  428.   end
  429.   module type Immediate = sig
  430. ‌    type t [@@immediate]
  431.   end

  433.   module Make(Immediate : Immediate)(Non_immediate : Non_immediate) : sig
  434.     type t [@@immediate64]
  435.     type 'a repr =
  436.       | Immediate : Immediate.t repr
  437.       | Non_immediate : Non_immediate.t repr
  438. ‌    val repr : t repr
  439.   end
  440. end
